EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) operating with fuel (recently topped up during smelting) and a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (5.0, 0.0) with fuel and a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)
 – Positioned with a drop at (-14.5, -48.5); operating with reduced fuel and currently issuing a warning: “output blocked by item on the ground. There is no sink entity in place to accept the output.”
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
 – Configured for transferring ore from the mining drill.
• Output Extraction System:
 – Output Inserter at (-14.5, -48.5) with pickup at (-14.5, -46.5) and drop at (-14.5, -48.5); note that an initial sink chest was placed then reset.
• Repositioned Burner Inserter
 – Moved next to the former sink chest location to refresh neighbor connections.
• Belt Network Reconfiguration Attempts:
 – Multiple segmented connection attempts from the mining drill drop (-14.5, -48.5) to the feeder inserter pickup (2.5, -1.5):
  • An initial attempt via an intermediate waypoint at (-6.0, -25.0) failed for the segment from (-14.5, -48.5) to (-6.0, -25.0), while the connecting segment from (-6.0, -25.0) to (2.5, -1.5) succeeded using 30 belts.
  • A subdivision into vertical (Segment 1a: from (-14.5, -48.5) to (-14.5, -25.0)) and horizontal (Segment 1b: from (-14.5, -25.0) to (-6.0, -25.0)) segments saw Segment 1a fail and Segment 1b succeed using 10 belts.
  • A further division into four axis‐aligned segments yielded:
   – Vertical from (-14.5, -48.5) to (-14.5, -25.5): failed.
   – Horizontal from (-14.5, -25.5) to (-6.5, -25.5): succeeded using 9 belts.
   – Vertical from (-6.5, -25.5) to (-6.5, -1.5): failed.
   – Horizontal from (-6.5, -1.5) to (2.5, -1.5): succeeded using 39 belts.
  • A grid‐aligned segmentation using integer endpoints managed to connect only the final segment—from (2, -2) to (2.5, -1.5) using 102 belts—while other segments encountered errors.
• Output Sink Resolution:
 – An attempt to place a wooden chest at the mining drill drop (-14.5, -48.5) to serve as a sink entity failed due to the player’s position (0,0) being too distant.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Insufficient Inventory Resources:
 – Verify that sufficient coal is available before operating furnaces; if inventory is low, harvest additional coal to maintain continuous smelting.
• Belt Network Path Normalization:
 – Use strictly axis‐aligned or grid‐aligned (integer) endpoints when connecting transport belts to avoid “Not a valid path to normalise” errors.
 – When errors occur, subdivide the connection into clear vertical and horizontal segments.
• Entity Placement Range:
 – Ensure the player is within the allowable placement distance when placing entities such as sink chests; move closer to the target tile to prevent placement range errors.
• Output Blockage Mitigation:
 – To resolve output blockage warnings, place a valid sink entity within the permissible placement range to accept output from the mining drill.
• Consistent Endpoint Coordination:
 – Maintain uniform coordinate precision in belt network reconfiguration to minimize path normalization issues.

NAMESPACE
─────────
shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity
 • Shifts the given entity’s position locally by the specified offset.
  – Invocation feedback: Successful repositioning noted, with caution advised for subsequent adjustments.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
